grading_system.description: Green-Yellow-Red (GYR) Color-Coded Placard System - Green (Pass), Yellow (Conditional Pass requiring 24-72 hour re-inspection), Red (Closed)

inspection_details.frequency: Food preparation facilities inspected approximately 3 times per year; retail markets inspected 2 times per year
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Yellow placard requires follow-up inspection within 24-72 hours; major violations require re-inspection unless corrected during inspection
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Color-coded placards must be posted within 5 feet of main entrance; inspection reports available online and must be kept on-site for review upon request

fire_safety_authority.department_name: Local fire departments (varies by city within Sacramento County)
fire_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: NFPA 96 compliant systems required; semi-annual inspections every 6 months by licensed fire protection technician
fire_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Every 6 months for commercial kitchen fire suppression systems per NFPA standards

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (California Health and Safety Code Division 104, Part 7)
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: Local environmental health agencies enforce state California Retail Food Code - Sacramento County EMD conducts inspections for all incorporated cities and unincorporated areas
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Sacramento County Code supplements state requirements; includes specific placard posting requirements and inspection frequencies
permit_types: Food Safety Manager Certification (5-year validity, ANSI-accredited)

confidence_notes: Verified directly from official Sacramento County Environmental Management Department website with comprehensive documentation of Green-Yellow-Red placard system, inspection frequencies, and California Retail Food Code enforcement
verification_notes: All information confirmed from official county sources. Fire safety inspection requirements confirmed as NFPA standards enforced by local fire departments with 6-month inspection cycles for commercial kitchen suppression systems.
